Input/output library

Detailed Description

Input/output stream classes and PathName class for file and directory name string manipulation and FindFile for finding files or directories.

The stream classes have been modeled closely after java.io.* counterparts.

Common combination of stream usage is to use FileInputStream class with DataInputStream. For example to read data in platform- and endianess independent manner:

P(FileInputStream) filein = new FileInputStream( "myfile.dat" );
P(DataInputStream) datain = new DataInputStream( filein );
String mystring = datain->readUTF();
int myint = datain->readInt();
float myfloat = datain->readFloat();

Writing to the files would go exactly wise versa, so that DataInputStream would be replaced with DataOutputStream, readInt() with writeInt(x), etc.

PathName class is convenient for path name manipulation as name suggests. For example if you have a directory name and you want to concatenate a file name to it, you can write PathName(dirname,fname) without need to check does the directory name already end with slash or backslash. You can also retrieve directory name from file name by calling parent() method, for example in a situation where you want to load textures from the same directory as the filename.

FindFile iterates path names in a single directory or recursively in sub-directories. The class can be used to find files or directories by user-specified name or by user specified properties.

Function Documentation

BEGIN_NAMESPACE ( io   ) 

ByteArrayInputStream reads bytes from a memory buffer.

(for example if the file tried to be opened is a directory)

Creates an output stream to a memory buffer of specified initial capacity.

Creates an output stream to a user defined memory buffer. Note that user defined memory buffer is NOT deleted when ByteArrayOutputStream is deleted.

Discards all written bytes and resets write pointer.

Writes specified number of bytes to the stream.

Returns pointer to the memory buffer used by the stream.

Returns number of bytes written to the stream.

END_NAMESPACE (  ) 

Interface to operating system specific functionality.

Speculative interface which allows 'try to read option' style usage so you can try to get some command line option and if the query fails you can ask it with prompt.

Parsest the command line if any.

Parses integer option. For example when command line has "-maxcount 3" you can say int x; getInt("-maxcount",&x) and x will contain number 3.

Returns:
true if query succeeds.
Parses integer option. For example when command line has "-maxcount mystr" you can say String x; getInt("-maxcount",&x) and x will contain "mystr".
Returns:
true if query succeeds.
Returns true if specified option exists.

Returns number of arguments in command line.

Returns ith argument.
